name: AzureVm
help: Manage Linux or Windows virtual machines.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: The name of the Virtual Machine. You can configure the default using `az configure --defaults vm=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: VhdNamePrefix
properties.help: The VHD name prefix specify for the VM disks.

properties.name: Overwrite
properties.help: Overwrite the existing disk file.

properties.name: StorageContainer
properties.help: The storage account container name in which to save the disks.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: The name of the Virtual Machine. You can configure the default using `az configure --defaults vm=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: Name of the virtual machine.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: AttachDataDisks
properties.help: Attach existing data disks to the VM. Can use the name or ID of a managed disk or the URI to an unmanaged disk VHD.

properties.name: AttachOsDisk
properties.help: Attach an existing OS disk to the VM. Can use the name or ID of a managed disk or the URI to an unmanaged disk VHD.

properties.name: AvailabilitySet
properties.help: Name or ID of an existing availability set to add the VM to. None by default.

properties.name: BootDiagnosticsStorage
properties.help: Pre-existing storage account name or its blob uri to capture boot diagnostics. Its sku should be one of Standard_GRS, Standard_LRS and Standard_RAGRS.

properties.name: CustomData
properties.help: Custom init script file or text (cloud-init, cloud-config, etc..).

properties.name: Image
properties.help: The name of the operating system image as a URN alias, URN, custom image name or ID, or VHD blob URI. This parameter is required unless using `--attach-os-disk.`.

properties.name: LicenseType
properties.help: License type if the Windows image or disk used was licensed on-premises.

properties.name: Location
properties.help: Location in which to create VM and related resources. If default location is not configured, will default to the resource group's location.

properties.name: NoWait
properties.help: Do not wait for the long-running operation to finish.

properties.name: Secrets
properties.help: One or many Key Vault secrets as JSON strings or files via `@&lt;file path&gt;` containing `[{ "sourceVault": { "id": "value" }, "vaultCertificates": [{ "certificateUrl": "value", "certificateStore": "cert store name (only on windows)"}] }]`.

properties.name: Size
properties.help: The VM size to be created. See https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/pricing/details/virtual-machines/ for size info.

properties.name: Tags
properties.help: Space-separated tags in 'key[=value]' format. Use "" to clear existing tags.

properties.name: Validate
properties.help: Generate and validate the ARM template without creating any resources.

properties.name: Zone
properties.help: Availability zone into which to provision the resource.

properties.name: AdminPassword
properties.help: Password for the VM if authentication type is 'Password'.

properties.name: AdminUsername
properties.help: Username for the VM.

properties.name: AuthenticationType
properties.help: Type of authentication to use with the VM. Defaults to password for Windows and SSH public key for Linux.

properties.name: GenerateSshKeys
properties.help: Generate SSH public and private key files if missing. The keys will be stored in the ~/.ssh directory.

properties.name: SshDestKeyPath
properties.help: Destination file path on the VM for the SSH key.

properties.name: SshKeyValue
properties.help: The SSH public key or public key file path.

properties.name: AssignIdentity
properties.help: Accept system or user assigned identities separated by spaces. Use '[system]' to refer system assigned identity, or a resource id to refer user assigned identity. Check out help for more examples.

properties.name: Role
properties.help: Role name or id the system assigned identity will have.

properties.name: Scope
properties.help: Scope that the system assigned identity can access.

properties.name: PlanName
properties.help: Plan name.

properties.name: PlanProduct
properties.help: Plan product.

properties.name: PlanPromotionCode
properties.help: Plan promotion code.

properties.name: PlanPublisher
properties.help: Plan publisher.

properties.name: AcceleratedNetworking
properties.help: Enable accelerated networking. Unless specified, CLI will enable it based on machine image and size.

properties.name: Asgs
properties.help: Space-separated list of existing application security groups to associate with the VM.

properties.name: Nics
properties.help: Names or IDs of existing NICs to attach to the VM. The first NIC will be designated as primary. If omitted, a new NIC will be created. If an existing NIC is specified, do not specify subnet, VNet, public IP or NSG.

properties.name: Nsg
properties.help: The name to use when creating a new Network Security Group (default) or referencing an existing one. Can also reference an existing NSG by ID or specify "" for none.

properties.name: NsgRule
properties.help: NSG rule to create when creating a new NSG. Defaults to open ports for allowing RDP on Windows and allowing SSH on Linux.

properties.name: PrivateIpAddress
properties.help: Static private IP address (e.g. 10.0.0.5).

properties.name: PublicIpAddress
properties.help: Name of the public IP address when creating one (default) or referencing an existing one. Can also reference an existing public IP by ID or specify "" for None.

properties.name: PublicIpAddressDnsName
properties.help: Globally unique DNS name for a newly created public IP.

properties.name: PublicIpSku
properties.help: Sku.

properties.name: Subnet
properties.help: The name of the subnet when creating a new VNet or referencing an existing one. Can also reference an existing subnet by ID. If omitted, an appropriate VNet and subnet will be selected automatically, or a new one will be created.

properties.name: SubnetAddressPrefix
properties.help: The subnet IP address prefix to use when creating a new VNet in CIDR format.

properties.name: VnetAddressPrefix
properties.help: The IP address prefix to use when creating a new VNet in CIDR format.

properties.name: VnetName
properties.help: Name of the virtual network when creating a new one or referencing an existing one.

properties.name: DataDiskCaching
properties.help: Storage caching type for data disk(s), including 'None', 'ReadOnly', 'ReadWrite', etc. Use a singular value to apply on all disks, or use '<lun>=<vaule1> <lun>=<value2>' to configure individual disk.

properties.name: DataDiskSizesGb
properties.help: Space-separated empty managed data disk sizes in GB to create.

properties.name: OsDiskCaching
properties.help: Storage caching type for the VM OS disk. Default: ReadWrite.

properties.name: OsDiskName
properties.help: The name of the new VM OS disk.

properties.name: OsDiskSizeGb
properties.help: The size of the os disk in GB.

properties.name: OsType
properties.help: Type of OS installed on a custom VHD. Do not use when specifying an URN or URN alias.

properties.name: StorageAccount
properties.help: Only applicable when used with `--use-unmanaged-disk`. The name to use when creating a new storage account or referencing an existing one. If omitted, an appropriate storage account in the same resource group and location will be used, or a new one will be created.

properties.name: StorageContainerName
properties.help: Only applicable when used with `--use-unmanaged-disk`. Name of the storage container for the VM OS disk. Default: vhds.

properties.name: StorageSku
properties.help: The SKU of the storage account with which to persist VM.

properties.name: UseUnmanagedDisk
properties.help: Do not use managed disk to persist VM.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: The name of the Virtual Machine. You can configure the default using `az configure --defaults vm=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: NoWait
properties.help: Do not wait for the long-running operation to finish.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: The name of the Virtual Machine. You can configure the default using `az configure --defaults vm=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: ResourceGroup

properties.name: NoWait
properties.help: Do not wait for the long-running operation to finish.

properties.name: Yes
properties.help: Do not prompt for confirmation.

properties.name: ResourceGroup

properties.name: ShowDetails
properties.help: Show public ip address, FQDN, and power states. command will run slow.

properties.name: ResourceGroup

properties.name: Location
properties.help: Location. You can configure the default location using `az configure --defaults location=&lt;location&gt;`.

properties.name: All
properties.help: Show all information including vm sizes not available under the current subscription.

properties.name: Location
properties.help: Location. You can configure the default location using `az configure --defaults location=&lt;location&gt;`.

properties.name: ResourceType
properties.help: Resource types e.g. "availabilitySets", "snapshots", "disk", etc.

properties.name: Size
properties.help: Size name, partial name is accepted.

properties.name: Zone
properties.help: Show all vm size supporting availabilityt zones.

properties.name: Location
properties.help: Location. You can configure the default location using `az configure --defaults location=&lt;location&gt;`.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: The name of the Virtual Machine. You can configure the default using `az configure --defaults vm=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: The name of the virtual machine to open inbound traffic on.

properties.name: Port
properties.help: The port or port range (ex: 80-100) to open inbound traffic to. Use '*' to allow traffic to all ports.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: ApplyToSubnet
properties.help: Allow inbound traffic on the subnet instead of the NIC.

properties.name: NsgName
properties.help: The name of the network security group to create if one does not exist. Ignored if an NSG already exists.

properties.name: Priority
properties.help: Rule priority, between 100 (highest priority) and 4096 (lowest priority). Must be unique for each rule in the collection.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: The name of the Virtual Machine. You can configure the default using `az configure --defaults vm=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: ResourceGroup

properties.name: ResourceGroup

properties.name: DiskCaching
properties.help: Use singular value to apply across, or specify individual disks, e.g. 'os=ReadWrite 0=None 1=ReadOnly' should enable update os disk and 2 data disks.

properties.name: LicenseType
properties.help: License type if the Windows image or disk used was licensed on-premises.

properties.name: NoWait
properties.help: Do not wait for the long-running operation to finish.

properties.name: OsDisk
properties.help: Managed OS disk ID or name to swap to. Feature registration for 'Microsoft.Compute/AllowManagedDisksReplaceOSDisk' is needed.

properties.name: WriteAccelerator
properties.help: Enable/disable disk write accelerator. Use singular value 'true/false' to apply across, or specify individual disks, e.g.'os=true 1=true 2=true' for os disk and data disks with lun of 1 & 2.

properties.name: Add
properties.help: Add an object to a list of objects by specifying a path and key value pairs.  Example: --add property.listProperty <key=value, string or JSON string>.

properties.name: ForceString
properties.help: When using 'set' or 'add', preserve string literals instead of attempting to convert to JSON.

properties.name: Remove
properties.help: Remove a property or an element from a list.  Example: --remove property.list <indexToRemove> OR --remove propertyToRemove.

properties.name: Set
properties.help: Update an object by specifying a property path and value to set.  Example: --set property1.property2=<value>.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: The name of the Virtual Machine. You can configure the default using `az configure --defaults vm=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: Created
properties.help: Wait until created with 'provisioningState' at 'Succeeded'.

properties.name: Custom
properties.help: Wait until the condition satisfies a custom JMESPath query. E.g. provisioningState!='InProgress', instanceView.statuses[?code=='PowerState/running'].

properties.name: Deleted
properties.help: Wait until deleted.

properties.name: Exists
properties.help: Wait until the resource exists.

properties.name: Interval
properties.help: Polling interval in seconds.

properties.name: Timeout
properties.help: Maximum wait in seconds.

properties.name: Updated
properties.help: Wait until updated with provisioningState at 'Succeeded'.

properties.name: NoWait

properties.name: PlatformFaultDomainCount
properties.help: Fault Domain count.

properties.name: PlatformUpdateDomainCount
properties.help: Update Domain count. If unspecified, server picks the most optimal number like 5. For the latest defaults see https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/compute/availabilitysets/availabilitysets-create.

properties.name: NoAutoUpgrade
properties.help: By doing this, extension system will not pick the highest minor version for the specified version number, and will not auto update to the latest build/revision number on any scale set updates in future.

properties.name: ProtectedSettings
properties.help: Json string or a file path containing private configurations such as storage account keys, etc.

properties.name: CertificateStore
properties.help: Windows certificate store names. Default: My.

properties.name: Secrets
properties.help: Space-separated list of key vault secret URIs. Perhaps, produced by 'az keyvault secret list-versions --vault-name vaultname -n cert1 --query "[?attributes.enabled].id" -o tsv'.

properties.name: CertificateStore

properties.name: ForceUpdate
properties.help: Force to update even if the extension configuration has not changed.

properties.name: NoAutoUpgrade
properties.help: By doing this, extension system will not pick the highest minor version for the specified version number, and will not auto update to the latest build/revision number on any scale set updates in future.

properties.name: EncryptFormatAll
properties.help: Encrypts-formats data disks instead of encrypting them. Encrypt-formatting is a lot faster than in-place encryption but wipes out the partition getting encrypt-formatted.

properties.name: KeyEncryptionKeyvault
